heading: rants and raves
subheading: date: wed, 22 sep 1999 21:27:51 +0000 from: marcos verissimo alves (verissim@if.ufrj.br) to: newsfeedback@wired.com subject: corel linux this is in reference to (“corel’s linux open toquestion,”22.sep.99.). let’s just hope corel is not trying to mess things up with linux. let’sjust hope they are not trying to be a new microsoft by introducingnon-open features in linux, […]
author: wired blogs
text: date: wed, 22 sep 1999 21:27:51 +0000 from: marcos verissimo alves (verissim@if.ufrj.br)to: newsfeedback@wired.comsubject: corel linuxthis is in reference to ("corel's linux open toquestion,"22.sep.99.). let's just hope corel is not trying to mess things up with linux. let'sjust hope they are not trying to be a new microsoft by introducingnon-open features in linux, because this could really divide the linuxcommunity. many newcomers are coming used to [dealing] with microsoft –complete incompatibility with other oses – and might think that corel'sdistribution is a better one. after all, corel is a renowned company andhas a solid reputation. since they are releasing greatstuff like the version of wordperfect for linux, it could be worth atry.
